definition: to flee/to scuttle/to exile or banish/to amend or edit
cave/cavity/hole/acupuncture point/Taiwan pr. [xue4]
rat/mouse/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
to run away/to flee in disarray
to roam all over the place/to go into every nook and corner/to infiltrate/(of criminals, enemies etc) to be on the run/to flee and try to hide
to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously
to alter/to modify/to change/to tamper
criminal at large
to scamper off/to scurry off like a frightened rat
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
to invade and harass
to raid/an intrusion (of the enemy, or bandit groups)
to flee in disarray/to scatter
to rise rapidly/to shoot up
to become suddenly popular/suddenly all the rage
to flee in disorder and encamp somewhere
to disperse and flee, leaving no trace
to reword/to edit a text

sentences.english: The quick plum chest starts to escape a cold idea and even became cold Mou sons.
sentences.chinese: 敏梅胸口竄起一股寒意，連眸子都變冷了。

sentences.english: The cat darted at the mouse.
sentences.chinese: 這隻貓朝那隻老鼠竄了過去。

sentences.english: Keep in mind, jealousy may pop up when you least expect it.
sentences.chinese: 記住，嫉妒感會在你最意想不到的時候竄出來。

sentences.english: The little ugly duck murmured while walked, suddenly a courser scurried out.
sentences.chinese: 醜小鴨邊走邊說，突然，一直獵狗竄了出來。

sentences.english: Can we do it right now?
The rubber gaudio-videoe himself up to the police after two weeks on the run.
sentences.chinese: 那個搶劫犯在押竄了兩個星期後向警方自首了。

sentences.english: Police suspect she might have been "closet-hopping", moving from house to house.
sentences.chinese: 警方懷疑她可能是個“櫃子竄”，從這家竄到那家。

sentences.english: Police suspect she might have been "closet-hopping", moving from house to house.
sentences.chinese: 警方懷疑她可能是個“櫃子竄”，從這家竄到那家。
停電，水源枯竭，油價上竄。

sentences.english: I skipped up the stairs to the second floor.
sentences.chinese: 我三步兩腳竄上樓梯，來到二樓。

sentences.english: As I was walking along the path, several small animals started from the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 當我沿着小徑走時，幾隻小動物從灌林叢中竄了出來。

sentences.english: The mouse scampered into its hole.
sentences.chinese: 那隻老鼠敏捷地竄回洞裏。

sentences.english: Only a couple of hours later, the blaze had quickly spread to the neighboring Heilongjiang Province.
sentences.chinese: 僅僅幾小時後，火舌便迅速竄到了臨近的黑龍江省。

sentences.english: I saw flames advancing out of that building.
sentences.chinese: 我看到火苗從那幢樓裏竄出來。

sentences.english: The rabbit started from the bush.
sentences.chinese: 野兔從灌木叢中突然竄了出來。

sentences.english: I felt a child go down my spine.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得有一股寒氣順着我的脊樑骨往下竄。
